content.description: Overhanging feature into a cool arete. Interesting top out! Some heel toe cams may be useful.
content.location: On the downhill side of the Hamburger Crack boulder. Start with both hands in the slot horizontal slot.

content.description: This is the right arete of the rock.  Looks like it was blatsted when they put the road in.  Holds are a little rough and there is a blast hole on top.  Maybe the easiest way off the boulder...
content.protection: maybe 1 pad.  Crux for me was getting down.  The ground under the back of the boulder was pretty eroded.  You have to make a hard move to ease over the edge, or jump (sketchy).
content.location:
Climb right off the pavement.  This is the boulder on the left side of the road just after the classic Hamburger Crack.  Just a little way downhill from the Poison Oak area.  Same boulder as

Left of the Tree

.

content.description:
The arete left of the tree...  Down-climb

Right of the Tree

or hop off the back.
content.location: The boulder to the right of Hamburger Crack.  Left side of the road and  downhill from Poison Oak area.

content.description:
Across the road from Hamburger Crack is a hidden corridor capped by a roof. From deep down inside the northwest end of the corridor, climb up a downward flaring chimney, past a #3 placement, and stem your way into the main corridor. After carefully placing small gear, hop into the horizontal crack (wild). Slither through the horizontal traverse out towards a 6' roof. The traverse is pretty darn unique, and pumpy at the end when it squeezes you out. Save some juice for the roof mantle!

The gear anchor is above the roof so you might as well go full value. The mantle is incredible, don't miss it by stepping off left.
content.protection: Small nuts and cams from .1-4" and 6-7", plus slings. Scout your gear from across the crack. I place a black alien and #00 metolius in a pod, followed by a tricky nut placement to protect the hop/flop into the belly crawl.
content.location: Go left around the rock go a short hidden 4th class downclimb on the northwest corner of the rock. Scramble down into the cave. Start the route just a few feet from the down climb.

content.description: This is a roadside favorite.  As the name suggests, its a meaty little crack.  It is on the left side of the road on orange colored rock, just before Poison Oak Crack.  The blasted boulders before it, also on the left hand side of the road are fun bouldering also.

Start matched on the low jug, then move right 3 ft on crimps and  sidepulls to a good pinch then up the center of the face to a thin holds topout that has good feet. Good movement on solid rock (even though it is blasted).
content.location: The prominent blasted rock about 30 ft down the road from Hamburger Crack.

content.description: Amazing arete that climbs nice and easy. Good feet and sharp arete make this quite enjoyable. It can be climbed on the left or right side, both are good. Left is better.
content.location: On the boulder just up hill from Blasted Boulder 3 and downhill from Hamburger Crack there is a large boulder with an obvious arete.

content.description:
A rare moderate sport route in Woodson.

We found this route entirely by chance (and definitely were not the bolt setters or first ascentists). The Kennedy Book alludes to a face here but does not indicate it was bolted. The 5.10 rating also comes from the topo provided in a photo. It felt like a 5.10a to me.

The first bolt is easy to clip one move off of the standing flake. The crux comes after the second bolt where microedging, faith, and a lack of hands gets you to the third bolt. Past that you are golden and the slab flattens. Fourth bolt is a breeze.

Walk off on climbers right.
content.protection: 4 quickdraws for the lead. Two bolt anchor at the top. Walk off. Well protected
content.location: Right off the road on the left after passing Hamburger crack and before poison oak crack/big grunt. You'll see the bolts.
